010package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.guibas;
011
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.DelaunayTriangulation;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This is an implementation of the triangulation algorithm described in [1].
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] L. J. Guibas, D. E. Knuth, and M. Sharir" "Randomized incremental construction of 
028 * Delaunay and Voronoi diagrams", Algorithmica, 7, pp. 381--413 (1992).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public class TriangulationGuibas implements DelaunayTriangulation {
035
036        private final List<Pnt2d> points;
037        private final List<Triangle2D> triangles;
038        private final Triangle2D outerTriangle;
039
040        /**
041         * Constructor. 
042         * @param points the point set to be triangulated
043         * @param shuffle set {@code true} to randomly shuffle the input points
044         */
045        public TriangulationGuibas(Collection<? extends Pnt2d> points, boolean shuffle) {
046                // TODO: change to point array or iterable!
047                if (points == null || points.size() < 3) {
048                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Point set must contain at least 3 points.");
049                }
050                this.points = new ArrayList<Pnt2d>(points);
051                if (shuffle) {
052                        Collections.shuffle(this.points);
053                }
054                this.outerTriangle = new Triangle2D(DelaunayTriangulation.makeOuterTriangle(points));
055                this.triangles = new ArrayList<>();
056                triangulate();
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Constructor. 
061         * Supplied points are inserted without shuffling, i.e.,
062         * in their original order.
063         * 
064         * @param points the point set to be triangulated
065         */
066        public TriangulationGuibas(Collection<? extends Pnt2d> points) {
067                this(points, false);
068        }
069        
070        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
071        
072        @Override
073        public int size() {
074                return triangles.size();
075        }
076        
077        @Override
078        public List<Triangle> getTriangles() {
079                return Collections.unmodifiableList(triangles);
080        }
081        
082        @Override
083        public List<Pnt2d> getPoints() {
084                return points;
085        }
086        
087        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
088
089        private void triangulate() {
090                triangles.add(outerTriangle);
091                
092                for (Pnt2d pnt : points) {
093                        Triangle2D triangle = this.findContainingTriangle(pnt);
094
095                        if (triangle == null) { // pnt is outside of any triangle
096                                /* If no containing triangle exists, then the vertex is not inside a triangle
097                                 * (this can also happen due to numerical errors) and lies on an edge. In order
098                                 * to find this edge we search all edges of the triangle soup and select the one
099                                 * which is nearest to the point we try to add. This edge is removed and four
100                                 * new edges are added.
101                                 */
102                                Edge2D edge = this.findNearestEdge(pnt);
103
104                                Triangle2D tr1 = this.findOneTriangleSharing(edge);
105                                Triangle2D tr2 = this.findNeighbour(tr1, edge);
106
107                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex1 = tr1.getOppositeVertex(edge);
108                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex2 = tr2.getOppositeVertex(edge);
109
110                                triangles.remove(tr1);
111                                triangles.remove(tr2);
112
113                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
114                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
115                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
116                                Triangle2D triangle4 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
117
118                                triangles.add(triangle1);
119                                triangles.add(triangle2);
120                                triangles.add(triangle3);
121                                triangles.add(triangle4);
122
123
124                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
125                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
126                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
127                                legalizeEdge(triangle4, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
128                        } 
129                        else { // pnt is inside the triangle <a,b,c>.
130                                Pnt2d a = triangle.a;
131                                Pnt2d b = triangle.b;
132                                Pnt2d c = triangle.c;
133
134                                triangles.remove(triangle);
135
136                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(a, b, pnt);
137                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(b, c, pnt);
138                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(c, a, pnt);
139
140                                triangles.add(triangle1);
141                                triangles.add(triangle2);
142                                triangles.add(triangle3);
143
144                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(a, b), pnt);
145                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(b, c), pnt);
146                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(c, a), pnt);
147                        }
148                }
149
150                // Remove all triangles containing any vertex of the super triangle:
151                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.a);
152                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.b);
153                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.c);
154        }
155
156        /**
157         * This method legalizes edges by recursively flipping all illegal edges.
158         * 
159         * @param triangle  the triangle
160         * @param edge      the edge to be legalized
161         * @param newVertex the new vertex
162         */
163        private void legalizeEdge(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge, Pnt2d newVertex) {
164                Triangle2D neighbourTriangle = this.findNeighbour(triangle, edge);
165                // If the triangle has a neighbor, then legalize the edge
166                if (neighbourTriangle != null) {
167                        if (neighbourTriangle.isPointInCircumCircle(newVertex)) {
168                                triangles.remove(triangle);
169                                triangles.remove(neighbourTriangle);
170
171                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex = neighbourTriangle.getOppositeVertex(edge);
172
173                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a, newVertex);
174                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b, newVertex);
175
176                                triangles.add(triangle1);
177                                triangles.add(triangle2);
178
179                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a), newVertex);
180                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b), newVertex);
181                        }
182                }
183        }
184        
185        // triangle-related methods ---------------------------
186
187        /**
188         * Returns the triangle that contains the specified point or null if no
189         * such triangle exists.
190         * @param point the query point
191         * @return the containing triangle or {@code null} if none was found
192         */
193        public Triangle2D findContainingTriangle(Pnt2d point) {
194                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
195                        if (triangle.containsPoint(point)) {
196                                return triangle;
197                        }
198                }
199                return null;
200        }
201
202        /**
203         * Returns the neighboring triangle of the specified triangle sharing the same edge
204         * as specified. If no neighbor sharing the same edge exists {@code null} is returned.
205         * NOTE: Searching over ALL triangles seems to be unnecessarily expensive!
206         * 
207         * @param tri1 the triangle
208         * @param edge the edge
209         * @return the triangle's neighboring triangle sharing the same edge or {@code null} if no
210         *         such triangle exists
211         */
212        public Triangle2D findNeighbour(Triangle2D tri1, Edge2D edge) {
213                for (Triangle2D tri2 : triangles) {
214                        if (tri2.containsEdge(edge) && tri2 != tri1) {
215                                return tri2;
216                        }
217                }
218                return null;
219        }
220
221        /**
222         * Returns one of the possible triangles sharing the specified edge. Based on
223         * the ordering of the triangles in this triangle soup the returned triangle may
224         * differ. To find the other triangle that shares this edge use the
225         * {@code findNeighbour(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge)} method.
226         * @param edge the edge
227         * @return the triangle that shares the specified edge or {@code null} if none exists
228         */
229        public Triangle2D findOneTriangleSharing(Edge2D edge) {
230                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
231                        if (triangle.containsEdge(edge)) {
232                                return triangle;
233                        }
234                }
235                return null;
236        }
237        
238        /**
239         * Returns the triangle edge nearest to the specified point.
240         * 
241         * @param point the query point
242         * @return the triangle edge nearest to the specified point
243         */
244        public Edge2D findNearestEdge(Pnt2d point) {
245                Edge2D minEdge = null;
246                double minDist = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
247                for (Triangle2D tri : triangles) {
248                        Edge2D.Distance ed = tri.findMinEdgeDistance(point);
249                        double dist = ed.getDistance();
250                        if (dist < minDist) {
251                                minDist = dist;
252                                minEdge = ed.getEdge();
253                        }
254                }
255                return minEdge;
256        }
257
258        /**
259         * Removes all triangles that contain the specified corner point.
260         * @param point the corner point
261         */
262        public void removeTrianglesUsing(Pnt2d point) {
263                List<Triangle2D> trianglesToBeRemoved = new LinkedList<>();
264                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
265                        if (triangle.hasVertex(point)) {
266                                trianglesToBeRemoved.add(triangle);
267                        }
268                }
269                triangles.removeAll(trianglesToBeRemoved);
270        }
271}
